geovctrs 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference

Format and print geovctrs

Source: R/geo-print.R
geo_print.Rd

Format and prints the geo_summary() of an geovctr.

geo_print(x, ..., short = FALSE, col = TRUE)

geo_format(x, ..., short = FALSE, col = FALSE)

Arguments

x

A geometry-like object, or one that can be coerced to a geometry-like object using as_geovctr().
...

Passed to geo_format()
short

Use to print a shorter summary
col

Use to colourize the output

Examples

geo_format(head(geo_nc))
#> [1] "<MULTIPOLYGON>[1]{27} (-81.74107 36.23436...-81.23989 36.58965)"
#> [2] "<MULTIPOLYGON>[1]{26} (-81.34754 36.36536...-80.90344 36.57286)"
#> [3] "<MULTIPOLYGON>[1]{28} (-80.96577 36.23388...-80.43531 36.56521)"
#> [4] "<MULTIPOLYGON>[3]{38} (-76.33025 36.07282...-75.77316 36.55716)"
#> [5] "<MULTIPOLYGON>[1]{34} (-77.90121 36.16277...-77.07531 36.55629)"
#> [6] "<MULTIPOLYGON>[1]{22} (-77.21767 36.23024...-76.70750 36.55629)"
geo_print(head(geo_nc))
#> <geo_wkb[6]>
#> [1] <MULTIPOLYGON>[1]{27} (-81.74107 36.23436...-81.23989 36.58965)
#> [2] <MULTIPOLYGON>[1]{26} (-81.34754 36.36536...-80.90344 36.57286)
#> [3] <MULTIPOLYGON>[1]{28} (-80.96577 36.23388...-80.43531 36.56521)
#> [4] <MULTIPOLYGON>[3]{38} (-76.33025 36.07282...-75.77316 36.55716)
#> [5] <MULTIPOLYGON>[1]{34} (-77.90121 36.16277...-77.07531 36.55629)
#> [6] <MULTIPOLYGON>[1]{22} (-77.21767 36.23024...-76.7075 36.55629)
